body:
We upgraded our api application from 3.2 to 4 and it was breaking some of the iOS clients when parsing the time from the api.

The ISO 8601 says that the fractional seconds is optional so it seems odd to default it to 3 instead of 0. If it is a matter of data loss why not default it to 5 or 6 or even 10?

Your implementation above would require the developer to reset `as_json_precision` on each `DateTime`, `Time`, & `TimeWithZone` to make sure they are consistent.

I understand the concern about adding more global options for JSON encoding, but it makes sense to have one place that all the Time classes get their configuration from, I think.
